data.question: What is the chemical formula of the coordination polymer synthesized using a specific home-made procedure?
data.answer: {[Co(ox)(Htr)2] (cid:1) 2H2O}n

data.question: What method was reported for organizing coordination polymers on solid surfaces?
data.answer: The method involves the deposition from vapor phase on a substrate of oligomeric species obtained by direct sublimation of a bulk MOF in vacuum.

data.question: What are the substrate temperatures used for depositing the MOF on highly oriented pyrolitic graphite (HOPG) and mica Muskovita?
data.answer: The substrate temperatures ranged from room temperature (RT) to 473 K.

data.question: How does the length-to-width ratio (kl) of fibers formed on HOPG and mica compare?
data.answer: Fibers formed on HOPG have a kl as high as 70, while fibers grown on mica have an average kl of 22.

data.question: What is the role of the thermal energy supplied in the novel method for preparing MOFs on solid surfaces?
data.answer: The thermal energy supplied allows the sublimation of small oligomers and their later surface adsorption.

data.question: True or False: The sublimation method produces fibers with more homogeneous width distributions compared to those prepared from solutions.
data.answer: True

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymer [Pt2(n-butylCS2)4I]n behaves as a metallic electrical conductor at room temperature.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of increasing the sublimation time on the fibers formed on mica?
data.answer: Increasing the sublimation time leads to greater amounts of deposited material, and as a consequence the width, height, and length of the fibers tend to increase while retaining its longitudinal aspect ratio before layer formation.

data.question: What is the base pressure used during the sublimation of both coordination polymers?
data.answer: The base pressure used during the sublimation of both coordination polymers is 1 (cid:2) 10(cid:3)6 mbar.

data.question: True or False: The sublimation/adsorption process is reversible for both the {[Co(ox)(Htr)2] (cid:1) 2H2O}n and [Pt2(n-butylCS2)4I]n polymers.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the main advantage of the sublimation method over the deposition from solution method?
data.answer: The sublimation method produces straighter fibers, with more homogeneous width distributions and a lower density of impurities on areas not covered by the fibers.

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymer [Pt2(n-butylCS2)4I]n forms 1D structures when adsorbed on a mica substrate kept at room temperature during sublimation.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the binding energies for the coordination bonds in the [Pt2(n-butylCS2)4I]n polymer according to DFT calculations?
data.answer: The binding energies for the coordination bonds suggest that the polymer sublimates through fragmentation of the really weak Pt–I bonds.

data.question: True or False: The fibers obtained by sublimation are not preferentially aligned along in-plane directions.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of kinetics in the nanostructuration of metal–organic materials on surfaces?
data.answer: Kinetics plays a key role in the nanostructuration of metal–organic materials on surfaces, influencing the formation of MOFs with designed geometries.

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymer {[Co(ox)(Htr)2] (cid:1) 2H2O}n has a 1D symmetry with linear chains running along the c axis.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of substrate temperature on the morphology of the polymers deposited on mica?
data.answer: Adsorption at room temperature leads to surfaces covered by 3D islands, while deposition at 393 K produces fibers that reflect the 1D symmetry of the MOF bulk.

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymer [Pt2(n-butylCS2)4I]n was successfully obtained as fibers from deposition from solution.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the water release process in the analysis of the crystalline stability of the MOF?
data.answer: The water release is an endothermic process that indicates the crystalline stability of the MOF, with the anhydrous and crystalline compound remaining stable up to 543 K.

data.question: True or False: The comparison between the architectures observed on HOPG and mica surfaces suggests a higher diffusion rate on graphite than on mica.
data.answer: True
